characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: Author of 'A Modest Proposal'

characters.name: American acquaintance
characters.description: A knowledgeable American living in London who informed the narrator about the culinary qualities of children

characters.name: Principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: A gentleman who provided information about children's proficiency in stealing

characters.name: Very worthy person
characters.description: A patriotic friend who suggested refinements to the proposal regarding older children

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: A native of Formosa who came to London and shared stories about eating human flesh in his country

characters.name: The Pretender
characters.description: Political figure in Spain that Irish people fight for

characters.name: Emperor
characters.description: The Emperor of Formosa mentioned in Psalmanaazor's story

characters.name: Prime minister of state
characters.description: The Emperor's prime minister who purchased human flesh

characters.name: Plump girl of fifteen
characters.description: A girl who was crucified for attempting to poison the Emperor and whose body was sold

characters.name: Grave author
characters.description: A French physician who wrote about dietary effects on reproduction

characters.name: vintners
characters.description: Tavern owners who would prepare and serve the proposed food

characters.name: fine gentlemen
characters.description: Wealthy men who value themselves on their knowledge of good eating

characters.name: skilful cook
characters.description: A cook who understands how to please guests

characters.name: mothers
characters.description: Women who would care for their children knowing of future profit

characters.name: married women
characters.description: Wives who would compete to bring the fattest child to market

characters.name: men
characters.description: Husbands who would become fond of their pregnant wives

characters.name: wives
characters.description: Women during pregnancy who would be better treated by their husbands

characters.name: Lord Mayor
characters.description: Official who would host feasts featuring the proposed dish

characters.name: reader
characters.description: The intended audience of the proposal

characters.name: our women
characters.description: Irish women criticized for pride, vanity, idleness, and gaming

characters.name: Laplanders
characters.description: People used as comparison for loving one's country

characters.name: inhabitants of Topinamboo
characters.description: People used as comparison for loving one's country

characters.name: Jews
characters.description: Historical reference to infighting during siege

characters.name: landlords
characters.description: Property owners who should show mercy to tenants

characters.name: shopkeepers
characters.description: Merchants who would cheat customers

characters.name: narrator/author
characters.description: The person making the proposal, claims to have no personal interest, has no young children

characters.name: author's wife
characters.description: Wife of the narrator, described as past child-bearing

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
